column1: #Text=World Health Organization calls for ban on tobacco ads
#Text=The United Nations health agency the World Health Organization ( WHO ) has called for a ban on tobacco advertising and promotion in order to protect the world 's children .
#Text=The news release from the WHO came on Friday , one day before the annual World No Tobacco Day held each year on May 31 .
#Text=This year 's World No Tobacco Day focuses on highlighting the practices of tobacco companies in their efforts to promote their products to young people .
#Text=According to a WHO press release , studies show that young people are more likely to start smoking if exposed to tobacco advertising .
#Text=The WHO notes that only five percent of the world population " is covered by comprehensive bans on tobacco advertising , promotion and sponsorship " .

column1: #Text=" The WHO appeals to member states and policy-makers to require by law a comprehensive ban on all forms of advertising , promotion , and sponsorship of tobacco products , " said WHO Regional Director for Africa Luis Sambo , in a statement released Saturday in Kampala , Uganda .

column1: #Text=A ban on all tobacco advertising , promotion and sponsorship is a powerful tool we can use to protect the world ’s youth . — WHO Director-General Dr. Margaret Chan
#Text=" In order to survive , the tobacco industry needs to replace those who quit or die with new young consumers , " said WHO Director-General Dr. Margaret Chan .
#Text=" A ban on all tobacco advertising , promotion and sponsorship is a powerful tool we can use to protect the world ’s youth .
